text: A functional T-cell receptor signaling pathway is required for <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity .
Stimulation of the T-cell antigen receptor ( TCR ) induces activation of multiple tyrosine kinases , resulting in phosphorylation of numerous intracellular substrates .
One substrate is <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which is expressed exclusively in hematopoietic and trophoblast cells .
It contains a number of structural motifs , including Src homology 2 , Src homology 3 , and pleckstrin homology domains and a putative guanine nucleotide exchange domain .
The role of <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in TCR - mediated signaling processes is unclear .

Here , we show that overexpression of <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone in Jurkat T cells leads to activation of the nuclear factors , including NFAT , involved in <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

text: Furthermore , <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> synergizes with TCR stimulation in inducing NFAT - and <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent transcription .

In contrast , NFAT activation by a G-protein-coupled receptor is not modulated by <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> overexpression , suggesting that the effect is specific to the TCR signaling pathways .

text: Although removal of the first 67 amino acids of <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates its transforming potential in NIH 3T3 cells , this region appears to be required for its function in T cells .
We further demonstrate that the <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced NFAT activation is not mimicked by Ras activation , though its function is dependent upon Ras and Raf .

Furthermore , the activating function of <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is blocked by FK506 , suggesting that its activity also depends on <extra_id_0> calcineurin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

To further dissect <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> involvement in TCR signaling , we analyzed various Jurkat mutants deficient in TCR signaling function or TCR expression and showed that an intact TCR signaling pathway is required for <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to function .

However , overexpression of <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> does not appear to influence TCR - induced protein tyrosine phosphorylation or increases in cytoplasmic free calcium .

text: Taken together , our data suggest that <extra_id_0> p95vav <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays an important role at an yet unidentified proximal position in the TCR signaling cascade .
